availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James T. Chadwick (Breathitt County, Kentucky, soldier.)

body.p: Breathitt County, Kentucky, soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Lucinda Combs Chadwick. Father of John Chadwick and Nancy Chadwick. Mustered into the 5th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (C.S.A.) as second sergeant on October 9, 1862. Enrolled in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) on October 10, 1862. Served in the 14th Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry Regiment (U.S.A.) from February 13, 1863, to March 24, 1864.

ab.bibl:
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Breathitt County, Precinct 7, p. 448A.
Compiled Service Records of Confederate Soldiers Who Served in Organizations from the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 109, Microfilm Series M319, Roll 0107.
Compiled Service Records of Volunteer Union Soldiers Who Served in Organizations From the State of Kentucky, NARA RG 94, Microfilm Series M397, Roll 0128.
"James Thomas Chadwick (1834-1909)," Find A Grave, Memorial 15480478, accessed August 11, 2023, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/15480478.
